question: Rather than using your on-premises VDI solutions, which AWS service could be leveraged to provide your users the same functionality while removing your need to maintain and support a hardware infrastructure?
What is Glacier designed for? (Choose 3).

Your company is migrating its on-premises environment to AWS. Which service below would help you do a cost-benefit analysis of moving to AWS versus remaining on-premises to present to your board of directors?
What option below allows AWS RDS to failover to a secondary database in case of the primary database's failure?
There was an incident in your company's AWS environment. You have been asked to review the API activity to determine the cause. What service captures AWS API calls and activity?
Under the AWS Shared Responsibility Model and an IaaS implementation, which of the following areas of responsibility reside with the customer? (Choose two.)

Rather than creating accounts with passwords in AWS, your corporate policies require you to use your internal credentials via federation with AWS. Which technology could you use to establish federated authentication with AWS?
What resource can you use to learn about AWS architectural and security best practices?
In the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following is not your responsibility as the customer?
Which storage option is best suited for storing large quantities of archive documents?
Which of the choices below can be attached to an EC2 instance to store data?
Which AWS service allows you to increase the number of resources based on demand of the application or the users?
For cost optimization in the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, what are two options you must consider for S3?
answers: The number of S3 buckets you need.
Whether you need to use encryption
The total size in gigabytes of all objects being stored
Storage class being used or picked to store objects

question: hat AWS service can do standard SQL queries on data in an S3 bucket?
Your company needs to host a database in their AWS environment but needs to have control over patching. Which is the best choice?
If you want to use decoupled resources, which of the following AWS service can assist you?
In the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, what does AWS perform on your behalf for EBS volumes?
answers: Replication of the EBS volume across multiple regions
Replication of the EBS volume across multiple EC2 instances
Replication of the EBS volume across multiple Availability Zones
Replication of the EBS volume across the same Availability Zone

question: Your company wants to split budgets out in multiple ways in order to gain insight into costs by department and projects. Which AWS tool under the Billing Dashboard will allow easy implementation of this?
What tool listed below can you use to get an estimated monthly cost for your environment before you deploy resources?
What is AWS's Domain Name System?
According to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, what is the Customer responsible for when you create a security group? (Select TWO)
answers: Making sure the security groups are linked to the Elastic Network Interface (ENI) of the EC2 instance
Making sure the security group rules are applied immediately

question: What AWS service allows you to quickly provision a test environment to investigate possible breaches into your EC2 instance?
Which AWS service is used to control user access in your environment?
What is the main difference between an Availability Zone and an edge location?
answers: An Availability Zone is an isolated location within an AWS region. An edge location delivers cached content to the closest location to reduce latency for users.
An Availability Zone contains an AWS region. An edge location delivers cached content to the closest location to reduce latency for users.
An Availability Zone delivers cached content to the closest location to reduce latency for users. An edge location is an isolated location within an AWS region.
An Availability Zone is an isolated location within an AWS region. An edge location is an AWS-specific resource in the region.

question: Pick two AWS services that use serverless technology.

You have a new requirement for your application that needs a set of servers for a short period of time of up to four months. While the instances are needed for a short period, the instances must be always available for the full duration. What instance type would be the best choice?
What can you use to keep logs in an S3 bucket for a specific amount of time and then delete the logs?
answers: Configure lifecycle rules for the S3 bucket.
Enable CORS on your S3 bucket

question: Which AWS service can assist you with ensuring cost optimization in your AWS environment?

You have EC2 instances running at 90% utilization and you expect this to continue for at least a year. What type of EC2 instance would you choose to ensure your costs stay at a minimum and avoid interruption of the services on the EC2 instances?

Your company has a new requirement to split the AWS resources to each department and also to manage the multiple AWS accounts. What option below would allow effective management and a cost-efficient model to meet this requirement?
Which option below cannot be used to import data into Amazon Glacier?
Which of the following tools can best assist with identifying common security vulnerabilities?
Which AWS service would you choose to collect and track performance metrics like CPU utilization on your EC2 instances?
What service allows you to build your infrastructure as code?
What can be attached to an EC2 instance to store data?
Which is a benefit of CloudFront?
What storage option provides the option of lifecycle policies that can be used to move objects to archive storage?
Which disaster recovery option below has the highest downtime?
What do you use to ensure an EC2 instance has appropriate access to your S3 bucket?

You are logged into a new AWS account your company has created for you, but keep getting an error when trying to access the EC2 Dashboard. What is the most likely reason for you not being able to access the EC2 Dashboard?
answers: There is not an IAM access policy attached to your IAM role.
You do not have multi-factor authentication (MFA) enabled.
There is not an IAM access policy attached to your IAM user.
You are not part of an IAM group.

question: You have a dedicated web servers and database that remains largely idle but sometimes has huge spikes in activity. What can you architect to improve your cost-efficiency?
answers: Configure RDS Multi-AZ for performance optimization.
Migrate the web servers to EC2 spot instances.
Use an Elastic Load Balancer between your server and database.

question: Which of the following statements correctly describes the concept of Auto Scaling?
answers: To distribute traffic to multiple regions
To increase the size of the EC2 instance based on demand
To scale out resources based on demand
To distribute traffic to multiple EC2 instances

question: You need to monitor the average CPU usage of your EC2 instances. Which AWS service should you use?
How do you encrypt CloudTrail logs?
answers: Send all logs to S3, and enable server-side encryption.
No action is needed since they are automatically encrypted.

question: What tool below helps estimate the costs of moving your on-premises environment to AWS?

Is penetration testing allowed in your AWS account? Please select the best available answer.READ: https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/penetration-testing/https://aws.amazon.com/security/penetration-testing/
answers: Yes. Limited penetration is allowed for 8 services, but you must contact AWS first for some test types.
Yes. Contact AWS and ask them to begin your testing.
Yes. You are free to do penetration testing whenever you like.

question: Choose a benefit of RDS.
answers: Does not allow resizing of the capacity

question: What AWS service allows for distribution of incoming application traffic across multiple EC2 instances?
What AWS service is a fully managed petabyte-scale data warehouse service in AWS?
What is the difference between Cost Explorer and the AWS TCO calculator?
answers: The TCO calculator helps you estimate the cost savings of using AWS; the Cost Explorer help you analyze current AWS usage charges.
The Cost Explorer is a price list for each AWS service; the TCO calculator helps you calculate hourly EC2 usage cost.
The Cost Explorer helps you calculate hourly EC2 Usage cost; the TCO calculator is a price list for each AWS service.
The TCO calculator helps you analyze current AWS usage charges; the Cost Explorer helps you estimate the cost savings of using AWS.

question: Which of the following options are best practices for permissions in your AWS environment? (Choose TWO)
answers: Use customer-managed policies instead of AWS-managed policies.
Follow the principle of least privilege.
Rotate, remove, and update credentials on a regular schedule.
Use IAM users instead of groups.

question: How can you make sure your organization does not exceed its monthly budget?
answers: Sign up for the free alert under billing preferences in the AWS Management Console.
Set a schedule to regularly review the Billing and Cost Management dashboard each month.
Create an email alert in AWS Budgets.
In CloudWatch, create an alarm that triggers each time the limit is exceeded.

question: You need to determine who terminated several critical EC2 instances. Which of the following is the best option for finding out who is responsible?

After installing SSL/TLS for security, you were alerted that there is a consistent spike in one of your company's web servers hosting a large application. This increased activity slowed down your application. Which of the following is the best and most cost-effective option for resolving the slow speed and getting your application to respond quickly again?
answers: Create a custom CloudWatch script to monitor the resources and alert you when the application begins to degrade
Offload the SSL/TLS from running locally on your application to AWS CloudHSM
Migrate the application to a larger EC2 instance with more computing and networking capability
Create an auto-scaling group to scale out traffic based on demand

question: Which statement below best describes fault tolerance?
answers: Deploying resources across multiple Availability Zones
Deploying resources across multiple edge locations
Deploying resources across multiple AWS accounts

question: Edge locations have which of the following features? (Choose THREE)
answers: Distributes content across multiple AWS resources

question: You have a distributed application that sometimes processes large volumes of data. The application is designed to recover gracefully if any EC2 instance fails. Your task is to process the large volumes of data in the most cost-effective way. What instance type will work best and be the most cost-effective?
Which of the following statements regarding Auto Scaling is most accurate?
answers: Distributes traffic to multiple EC2 or RDS instances
Scales out resources based on demand
Increases the size of the EC2 instance based on demand

question: What tool is best for forecasting your AWS spending?
Which of the following services can be used as a web application firewall in your AWS environment?
AWS incorporates a variety of robust security services to counter common types of web attacks. Which type of attack is the AWS Shield service designed to protect against?

Your company has decided to retire their on-premises data warehouse and move to a similar solution in AWS for increased capacity and lower costs. Which AWS service would you explore for this initiative?
Which type of service offerings pushes the responsibility for configuration and operations to AWS and leaves the customer only responsible for loading their data?
AWS allows for resources to be added to a system without any downtime or interruption to services. What is this concept called?
Security groups and access control lists (ACLs) are two means of applying security rules within AWS. Which of the following statements is true?
answers: Security groups and ACLs can both be applied to subnets and instancesSecurity groups apply to instances; ACLs apply to subnets
Security groups apply to instances; ACLs apply to subnets
Security groups apply to subnets; ACLs apply to instances
Security groups and ACLs are only used on subnets
